New Records: The Cavs are just the seventh team in NBA history to open a season with a 32-4 record or better
Cleveland's 11th straight victory, improving its NBA-best record to 32-4 while snapping OKC's franchise-record win streak at 15 games
Jarrett Allen and Evan Mobley are the first Cavs teammates to each post 20+ points, 10+ rebounds and 5+ assists in the same game since LeBron James and Dwyane Wade on Nov. 17, 2017
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander led the Thunder with a game-high 31 points, while Jalen Williams added 25
Seven Cavs scored in double figures, as Cleveland outscored OKC 23-15 in the final 9:05 while holding the Thunder scoreless for the final two minutes
Jarrett Allen led the way for the Cavs with 25 points, 11 rebounds, six assists and three steals, while Evan Mobley added 21 points, 10 boards and seven dimes
Donovan Mitchell's two-handed hammer right before the half put the Cavs up 62-59 at the break
Cleveland went on an 8-0 spurt to take control, but SGA kept answering to keep OKC within striking distance
The Cavs outscored the Thunder 13-6 in the clutch, including 5-0 in the final two minutes
The Cavs grabbed the final five rebounds of the game, including three offensive boards to bleed the clock to triple zeroes
Pre-Game Insights: The game featured a 15-game win streak colliding with a 10-game win streak
Two teams from different conferences with .850+ win percentages faced off this late in a season
Post-Match Reflections: Jarrett Allen said postgame, 'It felt like a battle the whole night. They were scoring, we were scoring … At the end of the night, it came down to which team had more effort.'
Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson said, 'That was great. Great for the game. Doesn't matter who won, who lost … it was a beautiful game.'
Donovan Mitchell said, 'It was an incredible environment. Cleveland always shows out for big games … and they didn't disappoint tonight.'

Thunder coach Mark Daigneault said, 'They stretch you out. Because they got those point-of-attack guys, and then they’ve got the rim presence with the two bigs, and then they’ve got the shooters… You got to be really good in all facets on that end of the floor against them. That’s why they’re the best offense in the league.'
Daigneault also said, 'It’s just what happens when you play against really good opponents. It’s hard to get them every time when you’re playing against great teams.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavs are on pace to become the first team in NBA history to shoot over 50% from the field and over 40% from 3 in a single season
The game featured eight ties and 30 lead changes
The 30 lead changes were the second-most in a game this season
The game was the first this season where both teams scored 40+ points in a quarter
